<para style="s2">The descendants of Adam</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The first person God created was Adam. Adam's son was Seth. Seth's son was Enosh. Enosh's son was Kenan.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Kenan's son was Mahalalel. Mahalalel's son was Jared. Jared's son was Enoch.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Enoch's son was Methuselah. Methusalah's son was Lamech. Lamech's son was Noah.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Noah's sons were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Japheth</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />The sons  of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="6" style="v" />The sons  of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="7" style="v" />The descendants of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Ham</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="8" style="v" />The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim , Put, and Canaan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />The descendants of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca.</para>

<para style="li2">The sons  of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Another descendant of Cush was Nimrod. When he grew up, he became a mighty warrior on the earth.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Mizraim  was the ancestor of the Lud people-group, the Anam people-group, the Lehab people-group, the Naphtuh people-group,

<verse number="12" style="v" />the Pathrus people-group, the Casluh people-group, and the Caphtor people-group. The people of the Philistia region were descended from the Casluh people-group.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Canaan's first son was Sidon. He was also the ancestor of the Heth people-group,

<verse number="14" style="v" />the Jebus people-group, the Amor people-group, the Girgash people-group,

<verse number="15" style="v" />the Hiv people-group, the Ark people-group, the Sin people-group,

<verse number="16" style="v" />the Arvad people-group, the Zemar people-group, and the Hamath people-group.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Shem</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.</para>

<para style="li1">Aram's sons were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, who was the father of Eber.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Eber had two sons. One was named Peleg which sounds like the word that means 'divided' because during the time that he lived, the people on the earth were divided into various language groups. Peleg's younger brother was Joktan.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Joktan was the ancestor of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

<verse number="21" style="v" />Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

<verse number="22" style="v" />Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

<verse number="23" style="v" />Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />The descendants of Shem, in order from him to Abraham, were Arphaxad, Shelah,

<verse number="25" style="v" />Eber, Peleg, Reu,

<verse number="26" style="v" />Serug, Nahor, Terah,

<verse number="27" style="v" />and Abram, whose name was later changed to Abraham.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Abraham</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Abraham's sons were Isaac and Ishmael.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />The son of Abraham's slave wife Hagar was Ishmael. Ishmael's twelve sons were Nebaioth, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

<verse number="30" style="v" />Mishma, Dumah, Hadad, Tema,

<verse number="31" style="v" />Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />After Abraham's wife Sarah died, he took another wife named Keturah. Her sons were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.</para>

<para style="li2">Jokshan's sons were Sheba and Dedan.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Midian's sons were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Esau</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />The son of Abraham's wife Sarah was Isaac, and Isaac's sons were Esau and Jacob, whose name was later changed to Israel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="36" style="v" />The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho , Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="37" style="v" />Reuel's sons were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Seir</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Another descendant of Esau was Seir. His descendants lived in the Edom region. Seir's sons were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Lotan's sons were Hori and Homam, and Lotan's sister was Timna.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="40" style="v" />Shobal's sons were Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.</para>

<para style="li2">Zibeon's sons were Aiah and Anah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="41" style="v" />Anah's son was Dishon.</para>

<para style="li2">1 Dishon's sons were Hemdan , Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="42" style="v" />Ezer's sons were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan .</para>

<para style="li2">Dishan's sons were Uz and Aran.</para>

<para style="s2">The kings of Edom</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="43" style="v" />These are the names of the kings that ruled the Edom region before any kings ruled over Israel:</para>

<para style="li1">Bela, the son of Beor, was king in Edom, and the name of the city in which he lived was Dinhabah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="44" style="v" />When Bela died, Jobab, the son of Zerah from Bozrah city, became the king.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="45" style="v" />When Jobab died, Husham became the king. He was from the region where the Teman people-group lived.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="46" style="v" />When Husham died, Hadad, the son of Bedad, became the king. He ruled in Avith city. Hadad's army defeated the army of the Midian people-group in the Moab region.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="47" style="v" />When Hadad died, Samlah became the king. He was from Masrekah town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="48" style="v" />When Samlah died, Shaul became the king. He was from Rehoboth city along the Euphrates river.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="49" style="v" />When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan, the son of Achbor, became the king.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="50" style="v" />When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad became the king. He was from Pau city. His wife's name was Mehetabel; she was the daughter of Matred and the granddaughter of Me-Zahab.</para>

<verse number="51" style="v" />Then Hadad died.

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">The leaders of the clans of the Edom people-group were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

<verse number="52" style="v" />Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

<verse number="53" style="v" />Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

<verse number="54" style="v" />Magdiel, and Iram.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The sons of Jacob were Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Judah</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3" style="v" />Judah's sons were Er, Onan, and Shelah. Their mother was the daughter of Shua from the Canaan people-group. When Judah's oldest son Er grew up, he did something that Yahweh considered to be very wicked, so Yahweh caused him to die.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Judah and his daughter-in-law Tamar had twin boys named Perez and Zerah. So altogether Judah had five sons.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="6" style="v" />Zerah had five sons: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Darda .</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="7" style="v" />One of the sons of Zimri was Carmi. Carmi's son Achan  caused the people of Israel to experience much trouble, because he stole some of the things that had been dedicated to Yahweh to be destroyed.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Ethan's son was Azariah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />Hezron's sons were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb .</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was a leader of the tribe of Judah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Nahshon was the father of Salmon, who was the father of Boaz.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Jesse's oldest son was Eliab. His other sons were Abinadab, Shimea,

<verse number="14" style="v" />Nethanel, Raddai,

<verse number="15" style="v" />Ozem, and the youngest was David.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah's three sons were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.

<verse number="17" style="v" />Abigail's husband was Jether, a descendant of Ishmael, and their son was Amasa,</para>

<para style="s2">Descendants of Hezron</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Hezron's younger son Caleb had two wives. One of them, Azubah, gave birth to three sons, Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

<verse number="19" style="v" />When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath. Their son was Hur.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />When Hezron was sixty years old, he married  Makir's daughter, who was the sister of Gilead. The son of Hezron and Makir was Segub.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Segub was the father of Jair. Jair's army controlled twenty-three cities in the region ruled by Gilead.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />But the armies of Geshur and Aram captured those towns controlled by Jair. They also captured Kenath city and the nearby towns; altogether they captured sixty towns. The people who lived there were all descendants of Makir, the father of Gilead.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Shortly after Hezron died in Caleb-Ephrath town, his widow Abijah had a son Asshur; Asshur started Tekoa town.</para>

<para style="s2">Jerahmeel's descendants</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Hezron's oldest son was Jerahmeel. His sons were Ram, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah. Jerahmeel's oldest son was Ram.

<verse number="26" style="v" />Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah. Their son was Onam.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />The sons of Ram, Jerahmeel's oldest son, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Onam's sons were Shammai and Jada.</para>

<para style="li1">Shammai's sons were Nadab and Abishur.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Abishur's wife was Abihail. The sons of Abishur and Abihail were Ahban and Molid.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Nadab's sons were Seled and Appaim. Seled did not have any children.

<verse number="31" style="v" />Appaim's son was Ishi; Ishi's son was Sheshan. One of Sheshan's daughters was Ahlai.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />Shammai's younger brother was Jada. Jada's sons were Jether and Jonathan. Jether did not have any children.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Jonathan's sons were Peleth and Zaza.</para>

<para style="li1">Those were the descendants of Jerahmeel.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Sheshan did not have any sons; he had only daughters. He had a servant from Egypt whose name was Jarha.

<verse number="35" style="v" />Sheshan allowed his daughter to marry Jarha, and their son was Attai.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="36" style="v" />Attai was the father of Nathan.</para>

<para style="li1">Nathan was the father of Zabad.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="37" style="v" />Zabad was the father of Ephlal.</para>

<para style="li1">Ephlal was the father of Obed.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Obed was the father of Jehu.</para>

<para style="li1">Jehu was the father of Azariah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Azariah was the father of Helez.</para>

<para style="li1">Helez was the father of Eleasah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="40" style="v" />Eleasah was the father of Sismai.</para>

<para style="li1">Sismai was the father of Shallum.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="41" style="v" />Shallum was the father of Jekamiah.</para>

<para style="li1">And Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.</para>

<para style="s2">Caleb's descendants</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="42" style="v" />Jerahmeel's younger brother was Caleb.</para>

<para style="li1">Caleb's oldest son was Mesha. Mesha was the father of Ziph. Ziph was the father of Mareshah. Mareshah was the father of Hebron.

<verse number="43" style="v" />Hebron's sons were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

<verse number="44" style="v" />Shema was the father of Raham. Raham was the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="45" style="v" />Shammai was the father of Maon. Maon was the father of Beth-Zur.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="46" style="v" />Caleb had a slave wife who was named Ephah. Caleb and Ephah's sons were Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran had a son whom he also named Gazez.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="47" style="v" />Ephah's father was Jahdai. Jahdai was the father of six sons: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="48" style="v" />Caleb had another slave wife whose name was Maacah. Caleb and Maacah's sons were Sheber, Tirhanah,

<verse number="49" style="v" />Shaaph, and Sheva. Shaaph was the father of Madmannah. Sheva was the father of Macbenah and Gibea. Caleb's daughter was Acsah.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="50-51" style="v" />These people were also descendants of Caleb: Caleb had another wife whose name was Ephrathah. Their oldest son was Hur. Hur's sons were Shobal, Salma, and Hareph. Shobal started Kiriath-Jearim city. Salma started Bethlehem town. Hareph started Beth-Gader town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="52" style="v" />Shobal's descendants were Haroeh, and half of the Manahath people-group.

<verse number="53" style="v" />His descendants also included these clans that lived in Kiriath-Jearim: Ithri, Put, Shumath, and Mishra. The Zorath and Eshtaol clans were descendants of the Mishra clan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="54" style="v" />Salma's descendants in Bethlehem were the Netophath clan, the Atroth-Beth-Joab clan, the other half of the Manahath clan, and the Zor clan.

<verse number="55" style="v" />Salma's descendants also included the families at Jabez town who wrote and copied important documents. These were the Tirath clan, the Shimeath clan, and the Sucath clan. They were all from the Ken people-group who came from Hammath city, and who had married members of the family  of Rechab.</para>

<para style="s2">The sons of King David</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Six sons of King David were born in Hebron city.</para>

<para style="li1">His oldest son was Amnon, whose mother Ahinoam was from Jezreel city.</para>

<para style="li1">His next son was Daniel, whose mother was Abigail from Carmel city.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="2" style="v" />His next son was Absalom, whose mother was Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, the king who ruled in Geshur town.</para>

<para style="li1">His next son was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3" style="v" />The next son was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital.</para>

<para style="li1">His youngest son was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="4" style="v" />They were all born in Hebron, where David ruled for 7-1 years.</para>

<para style="p">After that, David ruled in Jerusalem for 33 years.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Many of David's children were born in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="li1">Bathsheba, the daughter of Ammiel, gave birth to four of his sons: Shammua , Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="6" style="v" />Nine other sons of David were also born there. They were Ibhar, Elishua , Eliphelet,

<verse number="7" style="v" />Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

<verse number="8" style="v" />Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />In addition to all those sons, David's slave wives also gave birth to sons. David also had one daughter whose name was Tamar.</para>

<para style="s2">The kings of Judah</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Solomon's son was King Rehoboam.</para>

<para style="li1">Rehoboam's son was King Abijah.</para>

<para style="li1">Abijah's son was King Asa.</para>

<para style="li1">Asa's son was King Jehoshaphat.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Jehoshaphat's son was King Jehoram .</para>

<para style="li1">Jehoram's son was King Ahaziah.</para>

<para style="li1">Ahaziah's son was King Joash.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Joash's son was King Amaziah.</para>

<para style="li1">Amaziah's son was King Azariah.</para>

<para style="li1">Azariah's son was King Jotham.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Jotham's son was King Ahaz.</para>

<para style="li1">Ahaz's son was King Hezekiah.</para>

<para style="li1">Hezekiah's son was King Manasseh.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />Manasseh's son was King Amon.</para>

<para style="li1">Amon's son was King Josiah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Josiah's oldest son was Johanan. His other sons were Jehoiakim, Zedekiah, and Shallum.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Jehoiakim's sons were Jehoiachin  and Zedekiah.</para>

<para style="s2">Other descendants of King David after the people of Judah were exiled</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />King Jehoiachin was captured and taken to Babylon. His sons were Shealtiel,

<verse number="18" style="v" />Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Pedaiah's sons were Zerubbabel and Shimei.</para>

<para style="li1">Two of Zerubbabel's sons were Meshullam and Hananiah, and their sister was Shelomith.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Zerubbabel's five other sons were Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />The descendants of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. Jeshaiah's son was Rephaiah. Rephaiah's son was Arnan. Arnan's son was Obadiah. Obadiah's son was Shecaniah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Shecaniah's son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah's five sons were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />Neariah's three sons were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Elioenai's seven sons were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.</para>

<para style="s2">Other clans descended from Judah</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The descendants of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="2" style="v" />Shobal's son was Reaiah. Reaiah was the father of Jahath, and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. They were the ancestors of the Zorath people-group.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3-4" style="v" />The oldest son of Caleb and his wife Ephrathah was Hur. Hur was the one who started Bethlehem town. His three sons were Etam, Penuel, and Ezer. Etam's sons were Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. Their sister was Hazzelelponi. Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />Hezron's son Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives whose names were Helah and Naarah.V</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="6" style="v" />The sons of Asshur and his wife Naarah were Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />The sons of Ashhur and his wife Helah were Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and Koz. Koz was the father of Anub, Hazzobebah, and the ancestor of the clans descended from Aharhel. Aharhel was the son of Harum.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />There was another descendant of Judah whose name was Jabez. He was more respected than his brothers were. His mother named him Jabez which means 'pain' because she said, "I was enduring much pain when I gave birth to him."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />One day he prayed to God whom his fellow Israelites worshiped, saying, "Please greatly bless me and increase my land. Remain [IDI] with me, and do not allow anyone to harm me. If you do that for me, I will not have any pain." And God did what Jabez requested him to do.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Another descendant of Judah was Shuhah. His younger brother Kelub was the father of Mehir. Mehir was the father of Eshton.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Eshton was the father of Beth-Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah. Tehinnah started Nahash town, but their families lived in Recah town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13-15" style="v" />Another descendant of Judah was Jephunneh. His son was Caleb. Caleb's sons were Iru, Elah, and Naam. Elah's son was Kenaz. The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Othniel's sons were Hathath and Meonothai. Meonothai was the father of Ophrah.</para>

<para style="li2">Seraiah was the father of Joab. Joab was the ancestor of the people who lived in Craftsmen's Valley. The valley was named that because many of the people who lived there were craftsmen.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Another descendant of Judah was Jehallelel. His sons were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17-18" style="v" />Another descendant of Judah was Ezrah. Ezrah's sons were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. Mered married Bithiah, who was the daughter of the king of Egypt. The children of Mered and Bithiah were Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah. Ishbah was the father of Eshtemoa. Ezrah also had a wife from Judah. She gave birth to Jered, Heber, and Jekuthiel. Jered was the father of  Zanoah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Hodiah's wife was Naham's sister. Hodiah's wife was the mother of two sons. One of them was the father of Keilah, the ancestor of the Gar people-group, and the other one was the father of Eshtemoa, the ancestor of the Maacath people-group.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Another descendant of Judah was Shimon. Shimon's sons were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan, and Tilon.</para>

<para style="li1">Another descendant of Judah was Ishi. His descendants were Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />One of Judah's sons was Shelah. Shelah's sons were Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, the families of those who made things from linen at Beth-Ashbea,

<verse number="22" style="v" />Jokim, and the men of Cozeba town, and Joash and Saraph, two men who married women from the Moab region and later lived in Bethlehem . All their names and a record of what they did are written in very old scrolls.

<verse number="23" style="v" />They made pottery for the king; some of them lived in Netaim town and some of them lived in Gederah town.</para>

<para style="s2">Descendants of Simeon</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Simeon's sons were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Shaul's son was Shallum. Shallum's son was Mibsam. Mibsam's son was Mishma.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="26" style="v" />Mishma's son was Hammuel. Hammuel's son was Zaccur. Zaccur's son was Shimei.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but none of his brothers had many children. So the descendants of Simeon never were as many as the descendants of his younger brother Judah.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />The descendants of Simeon lived in these cities and towns: Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar-Shual,</para>

<verse number="29" style="v" />Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,

<verse number="30" style="v" />Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,

<verse number="31" style="v" />Beth-Marcaboth, Hazar-Susim, Beth-Biri, and Shaaraim. They lived in those places until David became king.

<verse number="32" style="v" />They also lived in villages near those towns: Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token, and Ashan.

<verse number="33" style="v" />There were other villages where they lived, as far southwest as Baalath town. Those were the places where they lived, and they wrote the names of the members of their families.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="34-38" style="v" />The men in the following list were the leaders of their clans: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah the son of Amaziah, Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah. Joshibiah was the son of Seraiah and the grandson of Asiel. Other clan leaders were Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, and Ziza. Ziza was the son of Shiphi and the grandson of Allon, who was the son of Jedaiah, who was the son of Shimri, who was the son of Shemaiah.</para>

<para style="p">The members of those families became very large.</para>

<verse number="39" style="v" />They went outside of Gedor town on the east side of the valley to look for pastureland for their flocks of sheep.

<verse number="40" style="v" />They found good pastureland with plenty of grass. The place was peaceful and quiet.

<para style="p">Previously the descendants of Noah's son Ham had lived there.

  <verse number="41" style="v" />But while Hezekiah was the king of Judah, those leaders of the tribe of Simeon came to Gedor and fought against the descendants of Ham and destroyed their tents. They also fought against the descendants of Meun who were living there and they killed all of them. So now there are no descendants of Meun living there. The descendants of Simeon started to live there, because there was good pastureland there for their sheep.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="42" style="v" />Ishi's four sons Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel led five hundred other descendants of Simeon and attacked the people who were living in the hilly area of the Edom region.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />They killed the few descendants of Amalek who were still alive. From that time until now, the descendants of Simeon have lived in the Edom region.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Reuben</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Reuben was the oldest son of Jacob. Therefore, he should have received the special rights that belonged to firstborn sons. But he had sex with his father's slave wife, so his father gave those rights to the sons of his younger brother Joseph. And in the family records, Reuben is not mentioned first, like the firstborn sons always are.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Although Judah became more influential than his brothers, and a ruler of Judah descended from him, Joseph's family received the rights that belonged to firstborn sons.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But Reuben was Jacob's oldest son.</para>

<para style="li1">Reuben's sons were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="4" style="v" />Another descendant of Reuben was Joel. Joel's son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah's son was Gog. Gog's son was Shimei.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Shimei's son was Micah. Micah's son was Reaiah. Reaiah's son was Baal.

<verse number="6" style="v" />Baal's son was Beerah. Beerah was a leader of the tribe of Reuben. But Tiglath-Pileser the king of Assyria captured him and took him to Assyria.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />The names of these clans are listed here according to what is written in their family records.</para>

<para style="li1">The first name written was Jeiel. Then Zechariah,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and then Bela. Bela was the son of Azaz, and Azaz was the son of Shema, and Shema was the son of Joel. Reuben's clan was very large. Some of them lived near Aroer city as far north as Nebo town and Baal-Meon city.

<verse number="9" style="v" />Some of them lived further east, as far as the edge of the desert south of the Euphrates River. They went there because they had a huge amount of cattle, with the result that there was not enough pastureland for them in the Gilead region.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />When Saul was king of Israel, Bela's clan fought against the descendants of Hagar and defeated them. After that, Bela's clan lived in the tents that the descendants of Hagar had lived in previously, in all the area east of the Gilead region.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Gad</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />The tribe of Gad lived near the tribe of Reuben; they lived in the Bashan region, all the way east to Salecah town.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Joel was their chief; Shapham was his assistant; other leaders were Janai and Shaphat.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Other members of the tribe belonged to seven clans, whose leaders were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="14" style="v" />They were descendants of Abihail. Abihail was Huri's son. Huri was Jaroah's son. Jaroah was Gilead's son. Gilead was Michael's son. Michael was Jeshishai's son. Jeshishai was Jahdo's son. Jahdo was the son of Buz.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Ahi was Abdiel's son. Abdiel was Guni's son. Ahi was the leader of their clan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />The descendants of Gad lived in the towns of Gilead and Bashan regions, and on all the pastureland on the Sharon plain.

<verse number="17" style="v" />All of those names were written in the records of the clans of Gad during the time that Jotham was the king of Judah and Jeroboam was the king of Israel.</para>

<para style="s2">The armies of the tribes that lived east of the Jordan River</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />There were 44,760 soldiers from the tribes of Reuben and Gad and the eastern half of the tribe of Manasseh. They all carried shields and swords and bows and arrows. They were all trained to fight well in battles.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />They attacked the descendants of Hagar and the people of Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab cities.</para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />The men from those three tribes prayed to God during the battles, requesting him to help them. So he helped them, because they trusted in him. He enabled them to defeat [IDI] the descendants of Hagar and all those who were helping them.

<verse number="21" style="v" />They took the animals that belonged to the descendants of Hagar: They took 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, and 2,000 donkeys. They also captured 100,000 people.

<verse number="22" style="v" />But many descendants of Hagar were killed because God helped the people of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh. After that, those three tribes lived in that area until the army of Babylonia captured them and took them away to Babylon.

<para style="s2">The eastern half of the tribe of Manasseh</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />There were many people who belonged to the eastern half of the tribe of Manasseh. They lived in the Bashan region east of the Jordan River, as far north as Baal-Hermon, Senir, and Hermon Mountain.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Their clan leaders were Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were all strong, brave, and famous soldiers, and leaders of their clans.</para>

<verse number="25" style="v" />But they sinned against God, the one whom their ancestors had worshiped. They began to worship the gods that the people of that region had worshiped, the people whom God had enabled them to destroy!

<verse number="26" style="v" />So the God whom the Israelites worshiped incited Pul, the king of Assyria, to want to conquer those tribes. Pul's other name was Tiglath-Pileser. His army captured the people of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the eastern half of the tribe of Manasseh, and took them to various places in Assyria: Halah, Habor, Hara and near the Gozan River. They have lived in those places from that time to the present time.

<para style="s2">The descendants of Levi</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Levi's sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="2" style="v" />Kohath's sons were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3" style="v" />Amram's children were Miriam and her younger brothers Aaron and Moses.</para>

<para style="li1">Aaron's sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="4" style="v" />Eleazar was the father of Phinehas.</para>

<para style="li2">Phinehas was the father of Abishua.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="5" style="v" />Abishua was the father of Bukki.</para>

<para style="li2">Bukki was the father of Uzzi.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="6" style="v" />Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="7" style="v" />Meraioth was the father of Amariah.</para>

<para style="li2">Amariah was the father of Ahitub.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Ahitub was the father of Zadok.</para>

<para style="li2">Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="9" style="v" />Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah.</para>

<para style="li2">Azariah was the father of Johanan.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Johanan was the father of Azariah. Azariah was a priest in the temple that Solomon commanded to be built in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Azariah was the father of Amariah.</para>

<para style="li2">Amariah was the father of Ahitub.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Ahitub was the father of Zadok.</para>

<para style="li2">Zadok was the father of Shallum.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Shallum was the father of Hilkiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Hilkiah was the father of Azariah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="14" style="v" />Azariah was the father of Seraiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Jehozadak was forced to leave his home when Yahweh sent King Nebuchadnezzar's army  to capture many people in Jerusalem and other places in Judah and compel them to go to Babylonia.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Levi's sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="17" style="v" />Gershon's sons were Libni and Shimei.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Kohath's sons were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Merari's sons were Mahli and Mushi.</para>

<para style="b" />Here is a list of the descendants of Levi, who became leaders of their clans.

<para style="li1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Gershon's oldest son was Libni.</para>

<para style="li2">Libni's son was Jehath.</para>

<para style="li2">Jehath's son was Zimmah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="21" style="v" />Zimmah's son was Joah.</para>

<para style="li2">Joah's son was Iddo.</para>

<para style="li2">Iddo's son was Zerah.</para>

<para style="li2">Zerah's son was Jeatherai.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Kohath's other son was Amminadab.</para>

<para style="li2">Amminadab's son was Korah.</para>

<para style="li2">Korah's son was Assir.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="23" style="v" />Assir's son was Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah's son was Ebiasaph.</para>

<para style="li2">Ebiasaph's son was Assir.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Assir's son was Tahath.</para>

<para style="li2">Tahath's son was Uriel.</para>

<para style="li2">Uriel's son was Uzziah.</para>

<para style="li2">Uzziah's son was Shaul.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Elkanah's other sons were Amasai and Ahimoth.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="26" style="v" />Ahimoth's son was Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah's son was Zophai.</para>

<para style="li2">Zophai's son was Nahath.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Nahath's son was Eliab.</para>

<para style="li2">Eliab's son was Jeroham.</para>

<para style="li2">Jeroham's son was Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah's son was Samuel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Samuel's oldest son was Joel; his other son was Abijah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Merari's oldest son was Mahli.</para>

<para style="li2">Mahli's son was Libni.</para>

<para style="li2">Libni's son was Shimei.</para>

<para style="li2">Shimei's son was Uzzah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Uzzah's son was Shimea.</para>

<para style="li2">Shimea's son was Haggiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Haggiah's son was Asaiah.</para>

<para style="s2">The temple musicians</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="31" style="v" />After the Sacred Chest was brought to Jerusalem, King David appointed some of the men who were descendants of Levi to be in charge of the music in the place where the people worshiped Yahweh.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Those musicians first sang and played their instruments in the Sacred Tent, which was also called the Tent of Meeting, and they continued to do that until Solomon's workers built the temple of Yahweh in Jerusalem. In all their work, they obeyed the instructions that David had given them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Here is a list of the musicians and their sons:</para>

<para style="li1">From Kohath's descendants there was Heman, the leader of the singers.</para>

<para style="li2">Heman was the son of Joel.</para>

<para style="li2">Joel was the son of Samuel.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Samuel was the son of Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah was the son of Jeroham.</para>

<para style="li2">Jeroham was the son of Eliel.</para>

<para style="li2">Eliel was the son of Toah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="35" style="v" />Toah was the son of Zuph.</para>

<para style="li2">Zuph was the son of Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah was the son of Mahath.</para>

<para style="li2">Mahath was the son of Amasai.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="36" style="v" />Amasai was the son of another man whose name was Elkanah.</para>

<para style="li2">Elkanah was the son of Joel.</para>

<para style="li2">Joel was the son of Azariah.</para>

<para style="li2">Azariah was the son of Zephaniah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="37" style="v" />Zephaniah was the son of Tahath.</para>

<para style="li2">Tahath was the son of Assir.</para>

<para style="li2">Assir was the son of Ebiasaph.</para>

<para style="li2">Ebiasaph was the son of Korah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Korah was the son of Izhar.</para>

<para style="li2">Izhar was the son of Kohath.</para>

<para style="li2">Kohath was the son of Levi.</para>

<para style="li2">Levi was the son of Jacob.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Heman's helper was Asaph. His group stood at the right side of Heman.</para>

<para style="li2">Asaph was the son of Berekiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Berekiah was the son of Shimea.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="40" style="v" />Shimea was the son of Michael.</para>

<para style="li2">Michael was the son of Baaseiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Baaseiah was the son of Malkijah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="41" style="v" />Malkijah was the son of Ethni.</para>

<para style="li2">Ethni was the son of Zerah.</para>

<para style="li2">Zerah was the son of Adaiah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="42" style="v" />Adaiah was the son of Ethan.</para>

<para style="li2">Ethan was the son of Zimmah.</para>

<para style="li2">Zimmah was the son of Shimei.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="43" style="v" />Shimei was the son of Jahath.</para>

<para style="li2">Jahath was the son of Gershon,</para>

<para style="li2">and Gershon was the son of Levi.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="44" style="v" />A group of singers from Merari's family helped Heman and Asaph. They stood at the left of Heman. The leader of this group was Ethan, the son of Kishi.</para>

<para style="li2">Kishi was the son of Abdi.</para>

<para style="li2">Abdi was the son of Malluch.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="45" style="v" />Malluch was the son of Hashabiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Hashabiah was the son of Amaziah.</para>

<para style="li2">Amaziah was the son of Hilkiah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="46" style="v" />Hilkiah was the son of Amzi.</para>

<para style="li2">Amzi was the son of Bani.</para>

<para style="li2">Bani was the son of Shemer.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="47" style="v" />Shemer was the son of Mahli.</para>

<para style="li2">Mahli was the son of Mushi.</para>

<para style="li2">Mushi was the son of Merari,</para>

<para style="li2">and Merari was the son of Levi.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="p">

  <verse number="48" style="v" />The other descendants of Levi were appointed to do other work in the Sacred Tent, the place where the people worshiped Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="49" style="v" />Aaron and his descendants were the ones who placed on the altar the sacrifices that were to be burned completely, and they burned incense on another altar. Those sacrifices were in order that Yahweh would no longer be angry with the people of Israel for having sinned. Those men also did other work in the very holy place in the sacred tent, obeying the instructions that Moses, who served God well, had given to them.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="50" style="v" />These were the descendants of Aaron:</para>

<para style="li2">Aaron's son was Eleazar.</para>

<para style="li2">Eleazar's son was Phinehas.</para>

<para style="li2">Phinehas's son was Abishua.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="51" style="v" />Abishua's son was Bukki.</para>

<para style="li2">Bukki's son was Uzzi.</para>

<para style="li2">Uzzi's son was Zerahiah.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="52" style="v" />Zerahiah's son was Meraioth.</para>

<para style="li2">Meraioth's son was Amariah.</para>

<para style="li2">Amariah's son was Ahitub.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="53" style="v" />Ahitub's son was Zadok,</para>

<para style="li2">and Zadok's son was Ahimaaz.</para>

<para style="s2">Land for the descendants of Levi</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="54" style="v" />Here is a list of the places where Aaron's descendants lived. Those who were descendants of Kohath were the first group to be allotted cities to live in.

  <verse number="55" style="v" />They were allotted Hebron city in Judah and the pastureland around the city,

  <verse number="56" style="v" />but the fields farther from the city and the villages near the city were given to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.</para>

<verse number="57" style="v" />The descendants of Aaron who were descendants of Kohath were allotted Hebron, one of the cities to which people could flee and be protected if they accidentally killed someone. They also were allotted the towns and pastureland near Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,

<verse number="58" style="v" />Hilen, Debir,

<verse number="59" style="v" />Ashan, Juttah, and Beth-Shemesh.

<verse number="60" style="v" />They were also allotted Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth, and Anathoth cities from the tribe of Benjamin.Altogether, these clans descended from Kohath were allotted thirteen towns.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="61" style="v" />The other clans descended from Kohath were allotted ten towns from the clans of the tribe of Manasseh that lived west of the Jordan River.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="62" style="v" />The descendants of Gershon were allotted thirteen cities and towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the part of the tribe of Manasseh that lived in the Bashan region on the east side of the Jordan River.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="63" style="v" />The descendants of Merari were allotted twelve cities and towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="64" style="v" />The leaders of Israel allotted those towns and the nearby pasturelands to the descendants of Levi.

  <verse number="65" style="v" />They also allotted to them the cities and towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin that were listed previously.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="66" style="v" />Some of the descendants of Kohath were allotted towns from the tribe of Ephraim.

  <verse number="67" style="v" />They were allotted Shechem, which was one of the cities to which people could flee and be protected if they accidentally killed someone, along with the nearby pastureland in the hills of Ephraim. They were also allotted these towns and pastureland near them: Gezer,

  <verse number="68" style="v" />Jokmeam, Beth-Horon,

  <verse number="69" style="v" />Aijalon, and Gath-Rimmon.</para>

<verse number="70" style="v" />The other descendants of Kohath were allotted Aner and Bileam towns and the nearby pastureland from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that lives west of the Jordan River.

<para style="b" />

<para style="p">

  <verse number="71" style="v" />The descendants of Gershon, who were part of the tribe of Manasseh, lived east of the Jordan River. They were allotted the cities and towns and pastureland near them: Golan in the Bashan and Ashtaroth regions.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="72" style="v" />From the tribe of Issachar they were allotted cities and towns and pastureland near Kedesh, Daberath,

<verse number="73" style="v" />Ramoth, and Anem.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="74" style="v" />From the tribe of Asher they were allotted cities and towns and pastureland near Mashal, Abdon,

<verse number="75" style="v" />Hukok, and Rehob.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="76" style="v" />And from the tribe of Naphtali they were allotted cities and towns and pastureland near Kedesh in the Galilee region, and Hammon and Kiriathaim towns.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="77" style="v" />The other descendants of Levi, those descended from Merari, were allotted towns and pasturelands from the tribe of Zebulun near Jokneam, Kartah, Rimmono, and Tabor.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="78-79" style="v" />From the tribe of Reuben they were allotted cities and towns and pastureland near Bezer in the desert, Jahzah, Kedemoth, and Mephaath. The tribe of Reuben lived east of the Jordan River, across from Jericho.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="80" style="v" />From the tribe of Gad, they were allotted cities and towns and pastureland near Ramoth in the Gilead region, Mahanaim,

<verse number="81" style="v" />Heshbon, and Jazer.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Issachar</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Issachar's four sons were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="2" style="v" />Tola's sons were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel . They were all leaders of the clans descended from them.</para>

<para style="li2">In the record of Tola's descendants were the names of 22,600 men who were able to be in the army during the time that David was the king of Israel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3" style="v" />Uzzi's son was Izrahiah. Izrahiah's five sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. Izrahiah and his sons were all leaders of their clans.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="4" style="v" />In the record of Izrahiah's descendants were the names of 36,000 men who were able to be in the army because they had many wives and children.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />In the records of the clans descended from Issachar were the names of 87,000 men able to be in the army.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Benjamin</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="6" style="v" />The three sons of Benjamin were Bela, Beker, and Jediael.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />Bela's five sons were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were all leaders of clans.</para>

<para style="li2">In the records of the clans descended from Bela there were names of 22,034 men who were able to be in the army.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Beker's sons were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="9" style="v" />In the records of the clans descended from Beker were the names of 20,200 men and leaders of the clans who were able to be in the army.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Jediael's son was Bilhan. Bilhan's sons were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />They were all leaders of clans descended from them.</para>

<para style="li2">There were 17,200 of them who were able to be in the army.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Shuppim and Huppim were also members of this clan.</para>

<para style="li1">One of the descendants of Dan was Hushim.</para>

<para style="s2">Naphtali's sons</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />Naphtali's sons were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem. They were all descendants of Jacob's slave wife Bilhah.</para>

<para style="s2">Manasseh's descendants</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />This is a list of Manasseh's descendants. Manasseh had a slave wife who was from Syria. She was the mother of Asriel and Makir.</para>

<para style="li1">Makir was the father of Gilead.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Makir found a wife for Huppim and one for Shuppim.</para>

<para style="li2">Makir's sister's name was Maacah.</para>

<para style="li2">Makir had another son whose name was Zelophehad. Zelophehad had no sons; he had only daughters.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Makir's wife was Maacah, and she gave birth to two sons whom she named Peresh and Sheresh. Sheresh's sons were Ulam and Rakem.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="17" style="v" />Ulam's son was Bedan.</para>

<para style="li1">Those were descendants of Gilead, who was the son of Makir and grandson of Manasseh.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Makir's sister was the mother of Ishdod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Another son of Gilead was Shemida, whose sons were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.</para>

<para style="s2">Descendants of Ephraim</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />This is a list of the descendants of Ephraim.</para>

<para style="li2">One son of Ephraim's was Shuthelah.</para>

<para style="li2">Shuthelah's son was Bered.</para>

<para style="li2">Bered's son was Tahath.</para>

<para style="li2">Tahath's son was Eleadah.</para>

<para style="li2">Eleadah's son was also named Tahath.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="21" style="v" />Tahath's son was Zabad.</para>

<para style="li2">Zabad's son was Shuthelah.</para>

<para style="li1">Ephraim's other sons, Ezer and Elead, went to Gath city to steal some cows and sheep. But they were both killed by some of the men from that city.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Their father Ephraim cried for them for many days, and his family came to comfort him.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />Then he and his wife had sex  again, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. Ephraim named him Beriah which resembles the word 'trouble' because of the trouble that his family had experienced.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Ephraim's daughter was Sheerah. Her workers built three towns: Lower Beth-Horon, Upper Beth-Horon, and Uzzen-Sheerah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Another son of Ephraim was Rephah.</para>

<para style="li2">Rephah's son was Resheph.</para>

<para style="li2">Resheph's son was Telah.</para>

<para style="li2">Telah's son was Tahan.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="26" style="v" />Tahan's son was Ladan.</para>

<para style="li2">Ladan's son was Ammihud.</para>

<para style="li2">Ammihud's son was Elishama.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Elishama's son was Nun.</para>

<para style="li2">Nun's son was Joshua, the man who led the Israelites after Moses died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />This is a list of the cities and areas where the descendants of Ephraim lived:</para>

<para style="li1">Bethel and the nearby villages;</para>

<para style="li1">Naaran to the east;</para>

<para style="li1">Gezer to the west and the nearby villages; and</para>

<para style="li1">Shechem and the nearby villages. Those villages extended north as far as Ayyah and the nearby villages.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Along the border of the area where the descendants of Manasseh lived were these towns: Beth-Shan, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor, and the nearby villages.The people who lived in all those places were descendants of Jacob's son Joseph.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Asher</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Asher's sons were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="31" style="v" />Beriah's sons were Heber and Malkiel.</para>

<para style="li2">Malkiel was the father of Birzaith</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="32" style="v" />Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham. Their sister was Shua.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Japhlet's sons were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Japhlet's younger brother was Shomer. Shomer's sons were Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />Shomer's younger brother was Hotham . Hotham's sons were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="36" style="v" />Zophah's sons were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

<verse number="37" style="v" />Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran whose other name was Jether, and Beera.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Jether's sons were Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Another descendant of Asher was Ulla, whose sons were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="40" style="v" />All those men were descendants of Asher, and they were all leaders of their clans. They were brave warriors and excellent leaders. In the record of the clans that are descended from Asher are the names of 26,000 men who were able to be in the army.</para>

<para style="s2">The descendants of Benjamin</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Benjamin had five sons: Bela, Ashbel, Aharah,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Nohah, and Rapha.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="3" style="v" />Bela's sons were Addar, Gera, Abihud,

<verse number="4" style="v" />Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

<verse number="5" style="v" />Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="6" style="v" />One of Gera's sons was Ehud. The descendants of Ehud were leaders of their clans who lived in Geba city, but they were forced to move to Manahath city.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Ehud's sons were Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera.</para>

<para style="li2">Gera was the one who led them when they moved to Manahath. Gera was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="8-11" style="v" />Another descendant of Benjamin was Shaharaim. He and his wife Hushim had two sons, Abitub and Elpaal. In the Moab region, Shaharaim divorced Hushim and his other wife Baara. Then he married a woman whose name was Hodesh, and they had seven sons: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. They were all leaders of their clans.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="12-13" style="v" />Elpaal's sons were Eber, Misham, Shemed, Beriah, and Shema. Shemed built of Ono and Lod towns, and the nearby villages. Beriah and Shema were leaders of their clans, who lived in Aijalon city. They forced the people who lived in Gath city to leave their city.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="14-16" style="v" />Beriah's sons were Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth, Zebadiah, Arad, Eder, Michael, Ishpah, and Joha.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />Other descendants of Elpaal were another name also named Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19-21" style="v" />Another descendant of Benjamin was Shimei. Shimei's descendants included Jakim, Zicri, Zabdi, Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Shashak's sons were Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,

<verse number="23" style="v" />Abdon, Zicri, Hanan,

<verse number="24" style="v" />Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,

<verse number="25" style="v" />Iphdeiah, and Penuel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="26-27" style="v" />Another descendant of Benjamin was Jeroham, whose sons were Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah, Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zicri.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />In the records of these clans it is written that all those men were leaders of their clans, and they lived in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Another descendant of Benjamin was Jeiel. He lived in Gibeon town, and he was the leader of those who lived there. His wife was Maacah.

<verse number="30" style="v" />His oldest son was Abdon. His other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

<verse number="31" style="v" />Gedor, Ahio, Zeker, and Mikloth. </para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />Mikloth was the father of Shimeah. All these sons of Jeiel also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Ner was the father of Kish, and Kish was the father of King Saul.</para>

<para style="li1">Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Jonathan's son was Merib-Baal.</para>

<para style="li1">Merib-Baal was the father of Micah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />Micah's sons were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="36" style="v" />Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah.</para>

<para style="li1">Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.</para>

<para style="li1">Zimri was the father of Moza.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="37" style="v" />Moza was the father of Binea.</para>

<para style="li1">The son of Binea was Raphah.</para>

<para style="li1">The son of Raphah was Eleasah.</para>

<para style="li1">The son of Eleasah was Azel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Azel's younger brother was Eshek.</para>

<para style="li1">Eshek's oldest son was Ulam. His other sons were Jeush and Eliphelet.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="40" style="v" />Ulam's sons were brave warriors and good archers. Altogether they had 150 sons and grandsons.</para>

<para style="b" />Those were the descendants of Benjamin.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The names of all the people of Israel were listed named 'The Record of the Kings of Israel.'</para>

<para style="p">Many of the people of Judah were captured and forced to go to Babylon. That happened because they did not faithfully do what was pleasing to God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The first people who returned to Judah many years later and lived in their own land and in their own cities and towns were some Israelite priests, other descendants of Levi, and men who worked in the temple.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Other people from the tribes of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh also returned to Judah and lived in Jerusalem. This is a list of those people:</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="4" style="v" />Uthai the son of Ammihud. Ammihud was the son of Omri; Omri was the son of Imri; Imri was the son of Bani; Bani was a descendant of Perez; Perez was the son of Judah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />Asaiah and his sons were descendants of Shelah. Asaiah was the oldest son in his family.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="6" style="v" />Jeuel and others of his relatives in Zerah's clan. There were 690 people in this clan.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />Sallu, the son of Meshullam, from the tribe of Benjamin. Meshullam was the son of Hodaviah; Hodaviah was the son of Hassenuah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Ibneiah the son of Jeroham.</para>

<para style="li1">Elah the son of Uzzi. Uzzi was the son of Micri.</para>

<para style="li1">Meshullam the son of Shephatiah. Shephatiah was the son of Reuel; Reuel was the son of Ibnijah.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />In other records of the people descended from Benjamin, there are the names of 956 people who were living in Jerusalem. All these were leaders of their clans.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Some of the priests who returned to Judah were:</para>

<para style="li1">Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jakin,</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />and Azariah who was the son of Hilkiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Hilkiah who was the son of Meshullam;</para>

<para style="li2">Meshullam who was the son of Zadok,</para>

<para style="li2">Zadok who was the son of Meraioth;</para>

<para style="li2">Meraioth who was the son of Ahitub;</para>

<para style="li2">Ahitub who supervised the temple guards;</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Adaiah who was the son of Jeroham;</para>

<para style="li2">Jeroham who was the son of Pashhur;</para>

<para style="li2">Pashhur who was the son of Malchijah;</para>

<para style="li1">Maasai who was the son of Adiel;</para>

<para style="li2">Adiel who was the son of Jahzerah;</para>

<para style="li2">Jahzerah who was the son of Meshullam;</para>

<para style="li2">Meshullam who was the son of Meshillemith;</para>

<para style="li2">Meshillemith who was the son of Immer.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />There were also 1760 priests who returned to Judah. They were leaders of their clans, and they all were responsible for doing work in the temple of God.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />From the descendants of Levi who returned to Judah there was Shemaiah the son of Hasshub.</para>

<para style="li2">Hasshub was the son of Azrikam;</para>

<para style="li2">Azrikam was the son of Hashabiah;</para>

<para style="li2">Hashabiah was a descendant of Levi's youngest son Merari.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Other descendants of Levi who returned to Judah were Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica.</para>

<para style="li2">Mica was the son if Zicri;</para>

<para style="li2">Zicri was the son of Asaph.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />There was also Obadiah the son of Shemaiah.</para>

<para style="li2">Shemaiah was the son of Galal.</para>

<para style="li2">Galal was the son of Jeduthun.</para>

<para style="li1">There was also Berekiah the son of Asa.</para>

<para style="li2">Asa was the son of Elkanah, who lived in one of the villages where the Netophath people-clan lived.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />From the descendants of Levi who returned to Judah who guarded the temple gates there were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and some of their relatives. Shallum was their leader.

<verse number="18" style="v" />Those gatekeepers from the tribe of Levi stood at the King's Gate on the east side of the city.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Shallum was the son of Kore.</para>

<para style="li2">Kore was the son of Ebiasaph.</para>

<para style="li2">Ebiasaph was the son of Korah.</para>

<para style="li1">Shallum and his relatives were gatekeepers, and they were responsible to guard the gates of the temple of Yahweh, like their ancestors had done.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Previously Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, had supervised the gatekeepers, and Yahweh was with Phinehas.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance of the temple.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Altogether, there were 212 men who were chosen to guard the gates. Their names were written in the records of the clans in their villages. King David and the prophet Samuel appointed.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The work of those gatekeepers and their descendants was to guard the gates of the temple of Yahweh. The temple was built to replace the Sacred Tent.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />There were gatekeepers on each of the four sides of the temple.</para>

<verse number="25" style="v" />Sometimes it was necessary for the relatives of the gatekeepers who lived in those villages to come and help them. Each time some of them came, they helped the gatekeepers for seven days.

<verse number="26" style="v" />There were four descendants of Levi who worked every day, and they supervised the gatekeepers. They also took care of the rooms and treasures in the temple of God.

<verse number="27" style="v" />They remained awake all during the night to guard the temple, and each morning they opened the gates.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Some of the gatekeepers took care of the articles that were in the temple. They also took care of the flour, wine, olive oil, incense, and spices that were used in the sacrifices.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Other gatekeepers were appointed to take care of the other things in the temple.</para>

<verse number="30" style="v" />But some of the priests had the work of mixing the spices.

<verse number="31" style="v" />There was a descendant of Levi named Mattithiah, the oldest son of Shallum, who was a descendant of Korah. He was very dependable the work of baking the bread that was used in the offerings on the altar.

<verse number="32" style="v" />Some of the gatekeepers who were descended from Kohath prepared the new loaves of bread to display before God, the loaves that were placed on the table inside the temple every Sabbath day.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Some of the descendants of Levi were musicians who worked in the temple. The leaders of those families stayed in the rooms of the temple. They did not do any other work in the temple because they did musician work day and night.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Those are the names of the leaders of the clans descended from Levi. Their names were written in the records of the clans. They all lived in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />One of the descendants of Benjamin, Jeiel, lived in Gibeon city. He was the city leader. His wife's name was Maacah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="36" style="v" />His oldest son was Abdon.</para>

<para style="li1">His other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

<verse number="37" style="v" />Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="38" style="v" />Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. Jeiel's family lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="39" style="v" />Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of King Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="40" style="v" />Jonathan's son was Merib-Baal. Merib-Baal was the father of Micah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="41" style="v" />Micah's sons were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="42" style="v" />Ahaz was the father of Jadah . Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.</para>

<para style="li2">Zimri was the father of Moza.

<verse number="43" style="v" />Moza was the father of Binea.</para>

<para style="li2">The son of Binea was Rephaiah. The son of Rephaiah was Eleasah. The son of Eleasah was Azel.</para>

<para style="li2">

<verse number="44" style="v" />Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The army of Philistia again fought against the Israelites. The Israelite soldiers ran away from them, and many Israelites were killed  on Gilboa Mountain.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The soldiers of Philistia caught up with Saul and his sons, and they killed his sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The fighting was very fierce around Saul, and the archers shot Saul and wounded him severely.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Saul said to the man who was carrying his weapons, "Take out your sword and kill me with it, in order that these heathen Philistines will not be able to injure me further and make fun of me while I am dying." But the man who was carrying Saul's weapons was terrified and refused to do that. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it and died.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />When the man carrying his weapons saw that Saul was dead, he also threw himself on his own sword and died.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />So Saul and three of his sons all died, and none of his descendants ever became king.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />When the Israelites who were living in the valley saw that their army had run away and that Saul and his three sons were dead, they left their towns and ran away. Then the soldiers from Philistia came and occupied those towns.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />The next day, when the Philistines came to take away the weapons of the dead Israelite soldiers, they found the corpses of Saul and his three sons on Gilboa Mountain.</para>

<verse number="9" style="v" />They took the clothes off Saul's corpse and cut off his head and took it and Saul's armor.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Then they sent messengers throughout their land, to proclaim the news throughout their own area, to their idols and to the other people. They put Saul's armor in the temple where their idols were, and they hung Saul's head in the temple of their god Dagon.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />All the people who lived in Jabesh in the Gilead region heard what the Philistines had done to Saul's corpse.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />So the bravest men for seven days.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Saul died because he did not faithfully obey what Yahweh told him to do. He even went to a woman who talks to the spirits of dead people and asked her what he should do,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />instead of asking Yahweh what he should do. So Yahweh caused him to die, and he appointed David, the son of Jesse, to be the king of Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then the people of Israel came to David at Hebron town and said to him, "Listen, we have the same ancestors [IDI] that you have.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />In the past, when Saul was our king, it was you who led our Israelite soldiers in our battles. You are the one to whom our God promised, 'You will be the leader  of my people; you will be their king.'~"</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />So all the Israelite elders came to David at Hebron. And David made a sacred agreement with them while Yahweh was listening. They anointed him with olive oil to set him apart to be the king of the Israelite people. That is what Yahweh had previously told the prophet Samuel would happen.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />David and all the Israelite soldiers went to Jerusalem. At that time, Jerusalem was called Jebus, and the people who lived there were the Jebus people-group.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />They said to David, "Your soldiers will not be able to get inside our city!" But David's soldiers captured the city, even though it had strong walls around it, and since then it has been called the City of David.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />What happened was this: David said to his soldiers, "The one who leads our soldiers to attack the Jebus people-group will become the commander of all my army." Joab, the son of Zeruiah, led the soldiers, so he became the commander of all the army.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />After they captured the city with its strong walls around it, David moved there. That is why they named it the City of David.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />David's workers rebuilt the city, starting where the land was filled in and extending to the wall that was around the city. Joab's men repaired the other parts of the city.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />David became more and more powerful him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Yahweh had promised that David would become the king. And all the Israelite people were happy that David was their king.</para>

<para style="p">There were many soldiers who helped David's kingdom to remain strong.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />This is a list of David's most outstanding warriors:</para>

<para style="p">Jashobeam was from the Hacmon clan. He was the leader of David's three most powerful soldiers. One time he fought against three hundred enemies and killed them all with his spear.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Next was Eleazar, who was the son of Dodo from the clan of Ahoh.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />One day he was with David at Pas Dammim when the soldiers of Philistia gathered there for the battle. There was a field of barley there. At first the Israelite soldiers ran away from the soldiers of Philistia,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />but then David and Eleazar stopped in the middle of the field and fought to defend it and killed many of the soldiers of Philistia. Yahweh enabled them to win a great victory on that day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />One time three of David's thirty greatest warriors came to David when he was camping next to the huge rock outside the cave near Adullam. At that same time, the army of Philistia had camped in the Rephaim Valley.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />David was in a fortress, and some of the soldiers of Philistia were occupying Bethlehem.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />One day David very much wanted some water to drink and said, "I wish that someone would bring me some water from the well near the gate at Bethlehem!"</para>

<verse number="18" style="v" />So the three greatest warriors forced through the camp of Philistia soldiers and drew some water from the well, and brought it to David. But he would not drink it. Instead, he poured it out on the ground to be an offering to Yahweh.

<verse number="19" style="v" />He said, "Yahweh, it would certainly not be right for me to drink this water! That would be like  to die for me!" So he refused to drink it.

<para style="p">That was one of the things that David's three greatest warriors did.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Joab's younger brother Abishai was the leader of the thirty greatest warriors. One time Abishai fought three hundred enemy soldiers with his spear and killed them.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />So he became as famous as the three greatest warriors. He became their commander, even though he was not one of those three men.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Jehoiada's son Benaiah was a brave soldier from Kabzeel town who did great deeds. He killed two of the best warriors from the Moab people-group. One day he went down into a pit when snow was falling on the ground and killed a lion there.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />He also killed a soldier from Egypt who was 7-1 tall. The soldier from Egypt carried a spear that was as long as a weaver's rod. Benaiah had only a club, but he grabbed the other man's spear and killed him with it.</para>
