  <verse number="19" style="v" />Those were the groups of men who were descendants of Korah and Merari who guarded the gates of the temple.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Other descendants of Levi were in charge of the chests that contained the money that was dedicated to Yahweh, money that the people brought to the temple.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />One of those men was Ladan, a descendant of Gershon. He was the ancestor of several family groups. Jehiel was the leader of one of those family groups.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Others who had that work were Zetham and his younger brother Joel, who were the sons of Jehiel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Others who did that work were descendants of Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Shubael, a descendant of Moses's son Gershom, was the leader who was in charge of the money chests.

<verse number="25" style="v" />Others who did that work were the descendants of Gershom's younger brother Eliezer. Those men were Eliezer's son Rehabiah, Rehabiah's son Jeshaiah, Jeshaiah's son Joram, Joram's son Zicri, and Zicri's son Shelomith.</para>

<verse number="26" style="v" />Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of all the valuable things that had been dedicated to Yahweh by King David, by the leaders of the family groups, by the army commanders of 1,000 soldiers and commanders of 100 soldiers, and by other army commanders.

<verse number="27" style="v" />Some of the things that those army officers had taken from Israel's enemies in battles they dedicated for the repair of the temple of Yahweh.

<verse number="28" style="v" />And Shelomith and his relatives were also in charge of everything that had been dedicated to Yahweh by the prophet Samuel, by King Saul, and by David's two army commanders Ner and Joab.

<para style="li1"></para>

<verse number="29" style="v" />From the descendants of Izhar, Kenaniah and his sons were given work outside the temple area. They were officials and judges in various places in Israel.

<para style="li1">

<verse number="30" style="v" />From the descendants of Hebron, Hashabiah and his relatives were responsible for the work done for Yahweh and for the king in all the area west of the Jordan river. There were 1,700 of them who were able to do their work well.</para>

<verse number="31" style="v" />It was written in the records of the descendants of Hebron that Jeriah was their leader. When David had been ruling for almost forty years, they searched in those records, and they found names of capable men descended from Hebron who were at Jazer city in the Gilead region.

<verse number="32" style="v" />Jeriah had 2,700 relatives who were able to do their work well, and who were leaders of their families. King David put them in charge of governing the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the western half of the tribe of Manasseh, to be sure that all the people did what God and the king told them to do.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />This is a list of the Israelite men who served the king in the army. Some were leaders of families, some were commanders of 100 men, some were commanders of 1,000 men, and some were other officers. There were 24,000 men  in each group. Each group served one month of each year.</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">

<verse number="2" style="v" />Jashobeam, the son of Zabdiel, was in charge of the group that served during the first month of each year.

<verse number="3" style="v" />He was a descendant of Perez, and he was the commander of all the army officers during the first month of each year.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="4" style="v" />Dodai, from the clan of Ahohi, was the commander of the group that served during the following.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="5" style="v" />Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the Supreme Priest, was the commander of the group that served during the following month.

<verse number="6" style="v" />He was the one who was a mighty warrior among David's thirty greatest soldiers, and he was their leader. His son Ammizabad was his assistant.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="7" style="v" />Asahel, Joab's younger brother, was the commander of the group that served during the following month. Asahel's son Zebadiah became the commander after Asahel was killed.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="8" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Shamhuth, a descendant of Izrah.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Ira the son of Ikkesh from Tekoa town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Helez, a member of the Pelon clan from the tribe of Ephraim.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Sibbecai, a descendant of Zerah from Hushah town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Abiezer from Anathoth city in the tribe of Benjamin.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Maharai, a descendant of Zerah from Netophath town.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />The commander for the following month was Benaiah from Pirathon town in the tribe of Ephraim.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />The commander for the last month of each year was Heldai, a descendant of Othniel from Netophath town.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />This is a list of the administrators of the twelve tribes  of Israel:</para>

<para style="b" />

<para style="li1">Eliezer, the son of Zicri, was the administrator of the tribe of Reuben.</para>

<para style="li1">Shephatiah, the son of Maacah, was the administrator of the tribe of Simeon.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />Hashabiah, the son of Kemuel, was the administrator of the tribe of Levi.</para>

<para style="li1">Zadok was the administrator of the tribe of Aaron.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Elihu, David's older brother, was the administrator of the tribe of Judah.</para>

<para style="li1">Omri, the son of Michael, was the administrator of the tribe of Issachar.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />Ishmaiah, the son of Obadiah, was the administrator of the tribe of Zebulun.</para>

<para style="li1">Jerimoth, the son of Azriel, was the administrator of the tribe of Naphtali.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />Hoshea, the son of Azaziah, was the administrator of the tribe of Ephraim.</para>

<para style="li1">Joel, the son of Pedaiah, was the administrator of the tribe of the western half of the tribe of Manasseh.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />Iddo, the son of Zechariah, was the administrator of the eastern half of the tribe of Manasseh, in the Gilead region.</para>

<para style="li1">Jaasiel, the son of Abner, was the administrator of the tribe of Benjamin.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Azarel, the son of Jeroham, was the administrator of the tribe of Dan.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />David did not tell Joab to count the men who were less then twenty years old, because Yahweh had promised many years previously that there would be as many people in Israel as there are stars in the sky.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Joab and his helpers started to count the men of Israel, but they did not finish counting them because Joab knew that Yahweh was angry about their being counted. Yahweh punished  the people of Israel because of this counting, and as a result the total number of Israelite men able to serve in the army was not written on the scroll about King David's rule.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />Azmaveth, the son of Adiel, was in charge of the king's storehouses.</para>

<para style="li1">Jonathan, the son of Uzziah, was is charge of the storehouses in other towns and villages in Israel, and also in charge of the watchtowers.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="26" style="v" />Ezri the son of Kelub was in charge of the workers who farmed the land that belonged to the king.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Shimei from Ramath town was in charge of the king's vineyards.</para>

<para style="li1">Zabdi from Shepham town was in charge of storing the wine from the grapes produced in vineyards.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Baal-Hanan from Geder city was in charge of storing the olive oil.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Shitrai from the Sharon Plain was in charge of the herds of cattle that grazed there.</para>

<para style="li1">Shaphat the son of Adlai was in charge of the cattle in the valleys.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Obil, a descendant of Ishmael, was in charge of the camels.</para>

<para style="li1">Jehdeiah from Meronoth town was in charge of the donkeys.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="31" style="v" />Jaziz, a descendant of Hagar, was in charge of the king's flocks of sheep.</para>

<para style="p">All of those officials were in charge of the things that belonged to King David.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />David's uncle Jonathan was a wise counselor for him.</para>

<para style="li1">Jehiel, the son of Hacmoni, taught the king's sons.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Ahithophel was the king's official counselor.</para>

<para style="li1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Hushai from the Ark people-group was the king's special friend.</para>

<para style="li1">Benaiah's son Jehoiada became the king's advisor after Ahithophel died, and later Abiathar became his advisor.</para>

<para style="li1">Joab was the chief commander of the army.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />David summoned all the leaders of Israel to come to Jerusalem. He summoned the leaders of the tribes, the leaders of the groups that worked for the king, the commanders of 100 soldiers, the commanders of 1,000 soldiers, those who were in charge of the king's property and his livestock, those who taught his sons, all the palace officials, and his mighty soldiers and bravest warriors.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="2" style="v" />David stood up and said, "My fellow Israelites, listen to me. I wanted [IDI] to build a temple to be a place where we would put the Sacred Chest of Yahweh, where it would stay permanently. And I made plans to build it.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But God said to me, 'You are not the one who will arrange to build a temple for me  in battles.'</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />But Yahweh, the God to whom we Israelites belong, had chosen me and my descendants to be the kings of Israel forever. First he chose the tribe of Judah, and from the people  of Judah he chose my family, and from my father's sons he chose me to be the king over all of Israel.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Yahweh has given me many sons, but from them he chose my son Solomon to be the next king to rule  his kingdom of Israel.</para>

<verse number="6" style="v" />He said to me, 'Solomon your son is the one who will arrange to build my temple and the courtyards around it, because I have chosen him to be like my son and I will be like  his father.

<verse number="7" style="v" />I will enable his kingdom to endure forever if he continues to obey my laws and commands, like you are doing now.'

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />So now, while all you people of Israel, all of you who belong to Yahweh, are watching, and while God is listening, I command you leaders to carefully obey all the commands of Yahweh our God, in order that you may continue to possess this good land and enable your descendants to inherit it forever.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And you, my son Solomon, must know God like I know him, and you must serve him faithfully and because you want to. You must do that because he knows what everyone is thinking and he understands the reasons that people do what they do. If you seek to know him, he will heed your prayers. But if you abandon you forever.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Yahweh has chosen you to arrange to build a temple for him. So think about what I have said, and be strong and do what he is wanting you to do."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Then David gave to his son Solomon the scroll on which were written the plans for the main rooms of the temple, its porch, its storerooms, all the other upper and lower rooms, the Holy Place, and the Very Holy Place having the sacred chest and its lid.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />David wrote for him the plans that God's Spirit had put into his mind for building the courtyards and all the rooms that surrounded the temple, including the room where the money and other valuable things that were dedicated to God were kept.</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />He gave Solomon instructions for the groups of priests and other descendants of Levi, about all the work that they must do to serve in Yahweh's temple, and about taking care of all the things that would be used in the work at the temple.

<verse number="14" style="v" />He wrote down how much gold and how much silver should be used to make all the items in the temple:

<verse number="15" style="v" />how much gold for making the gold lampstands and the lamps, how much silver to make the silver lamps and lampstands,

<verse number="16" style="v" />how much gold for making the table on which the priests would put the bread to display before God, how much silver to make the other tables,

<verse number="17" style="v" />how much pure gold for the meat forks and the bowls and the cups, how much gold for each gold dish, how much silver for each silver dish,

<verse number="18" style="v" />and how much pure gold to make the altar for burning incense. He also gave to Solomon his plans for making the golden statues of winged creatures that would be above the Sacred Chest of Yahweh, like a chariot for him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Then David said, "I have written all these plans while Yahweh was directing  me. He has enabled me to understand all the details of his plan for the temple that is to be built."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />David also said to his son Solomon, "Be strong and courageous, and do this work. Do not be afraid or discouraged, because Yahweh our God will be with you. He will not fail to help you or abandon you until you finish all the work of making the temple of his.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The groups of priests and other descendants of Levi are ready to begin their work at the temple, and every man who has a special skill will help you in all the work. And my officials and the other people will obey you, whatever you command them to do."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then King David said to all the people who had gathered there, "My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen to be the next king, is young and does not have much experience. This work of building the temple is great, because this glorious building will not be to honor people, but to honor Yahweh our God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />From all the things that I possess, I have provided what will be needed to build the temple of my Godthe gold for the things to be made of gold, the silver for the things to be made of silver, bronze for the things to be made of bronze, iron for the things to be made of iron, wood for the things to be made of wood, and large amounts of onyx and turquoise and other valuable stones of various colors, and marble and all kinds of valuable stones.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />In addition to all these things that I have given for the temple, I am giving my own treasures of gold and silver, because I very earnestly desire that this holy temple for my God be built.

<verse number="4" style="v" />I am giving 110 tons of gold from Ophir and 260 tons of refined silver to cover the walls of the buildings,

<verse number="5" style="v" />for making the other items of gold and silver, and for the other work to be done by the craftsmen. So now, I ask you, who is willing to show by contributing other gifts for the building of the temple  that he has dedicated himself to Yahweh?"

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then the leaders of the families.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />For the work at the temple they gave 190 tons and 185 pounds of gold, 375 tons of silver, 675 tons of bronze, and 3,750 tons of iron.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />And any people who owned valuable stones gave them to be put in the storeroom of the temple. Jehiel, a descendant of Gershon, was appointed to be in charge of them.

<verse number="9" style="v" />The people were happy to see that their leaders wanted to give those things; they were happy and enthusiastic to give those things to Yahweh. And King David also was very happy.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Then, while all the people there were listening, David prayed. He said,</para>

<para style="q1">"We praise you, Yahweh,</para>

<para style="q2">the God whom our ancestor Jacob worshiped.</para>

<para style="q2">We will praise you forever!</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />You alone are great and powerful;</para>

<para style="q2">only you are truly glorious and majestic and wonderful.</para>

<para style="q2">And that is true because everything in heaven and on the earth is yours.</para>

<para style="q1">You are the king of all the people in this world;</para>

<para style="q2">you are the ruler of everything.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Because you are very powerful ,</para>

<para style="q2">you are able to cause anyone to be great and be strong.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />So now, our God, we thank you,</para>

<para style="q2">and we praise you  for being very great.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />But I and my people are not really able to give anything to you,</para>

<para style="q2">because everything that we have comes from you,</para>

<para style="q2">and what we have given to you are only the things that we have received from you .</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />We are like  foreigners and strangers to you, like our ancestors were.</para>

<para style="q2">Our years a shadow that disappears quickly;</para>

<para style="q2">we know that there is nothing that can enable us to escape dying.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />Yahweh our God, we have gathered all these things to use in building your  temple,</para>

<para style="q2">but all of it really belongs to you, and you have given it to us .</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />My God, I know that you test us people,</para>

<para style="q2">and you are pleased if you find out that we do what is right.</para>

<para style="q1">All these things I have given to you because I wanted to.</para>

<para style="q2">And now I have seen that your people have joyfully and generously given things to you.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Yahweh, the God whom our ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob worshiped,</para>

<para style="q2">I desire that your people will continue to desire to do things like this forever,</para>

<para style="q2">and that they will always be loyal to you.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />And now, please enable my son Solomon to faithfully and sincerely </para>

<para style="q2">and to do everything that is needed to build this beautiful building</para>

<para style="q2">for which I have provided all these things."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Then David said to all the people who were gathered there, "Praise Yahweh our God!" So they all praised Yahweh the God whom their ancestors also worshiped. They prostrated themselves on the ground in front of Yahweh and in front of the king.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The next day the people offered sacrifices to Yahweh. They presented many animals to be completely burned on the altar: A thousand bulls, a thousand rams, a thousand male sheep, offerings of wine, and many other sacrifices for all the people of Israel.</para>

<verse number="22" style="v" />On that day the people were joyful and ate and drank while Yahweh was watching.

<para style="p">Then for the second time they declared that Solomon was now the king. While Yahweh was watching, they anointed him with olive oil to be the king, and they anointed Zadok to be the Supreme Priest.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />So Solomon sat on the throne because Yahweh has wanted him to be the king to succeed his father David. During the following years Solomon prospered, and all the Israelite people obeyed him.</para>

<verse number="24" style="v" />King David's other sons and all the officers and mighty warriors accepted Solomon to be their king, and they solemnly promised to obey him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Yahweh caused Solomon to be highly respected by all the Israelite people, and they honored him very much. No king of Israel was honored as much as Solomon was.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Jesse's son David was the king who ruled all of Israel.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />He ruled for forty years: seven years in Hebron city and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />He was very rich and very much honored , and he became an old man. Then he died, and his son Solomon became the king of Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />A record of all the things that King David did while he ruled, from the beginning to the end, was on scrolls written by the prophets Samuel, Nathan, and Gad.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />They told about his powerful rule , and all the things that happened to him and to the people of Israel and in the kingdoms of other countries while he was ruling Israel.</para>
